direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the state of the iterator and require the same preconditions (nextCalled and not removed).
Both methods reset or modify the internal state of the iterator, though reset() does so more comprehensively.
The set method depends on the next method having been called, indicating a direct dependency.
Both methods throw IllegalStateException under similar conditions related to the state of the iterator.
Both methods attempt to modify the iterator's state, though add throws an exception instead of performing an action.
